thread.title: KSU's Bill Snyder apologizes to students
thread.title_full: KSU's Bill Snyder apologizes to students - KCTV5

author: Neal Jones, News Producer/Editor
title: KSU's Bill Snyder apologizes to students
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Kansas State football coach Bill Snyder has apologized to Kansas State's students for the Wildcats blow out loss to Oklahoma.
The Sooners beat Snyder's Wildcats 55 to 0 on Saturday. It is the worst home loss in Snyder's KSU career.
After the game, the 24-year Kansas State coach sent out a letter to KSU students.
"Please accept my apology for for the manner in which we represented you on Saturday. I know you are pained by the outcome, as I am. I hope that you will appreciate our players for never giving up  even in the face of such adversity."
The Cats lost their starting quarterback on the first play of the 2015 season opener, then lost their second stringer weeks later. That's left them with a third-string QB and a wide receiver as their only quarterbacks.
Kansas State was held to just 5 of 22 passing for a paltry 45 yards, and three interceptions. 
The loss drops the Cats to 0-3 in the Big 12, 3-3 overall.
They host number-2 ranked Baylor on Saturday.
